content: If the capability does not yet exist, please create an idea at https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas/label-name/thunderbird%20android where you can also vote on other ideas.
creator: wsmwk

content:
The following steps might be helpful. Although the following steps might not be exactly what you want, I think they are close.

"Settings". > "Accounts" section. > Tap the account you want to configure. > "Sending mail". > "Composition defaults". > Enter one or more email addresses in "Bcc all messages to" field. If you want to enter multiple email addresses, separate email addresses with commas. > Tap "SAVE" on the top right corner.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: Thanks for the Reply. I noticed the Blind Cc option but hoped I missed something. You brought it home that this is indeed the closest solution. Until the Cc option is included. It does give what I wanted -a return to my mailbox with each Send so I can confirm successful send. I save these as .eml to a disk folder but must be careful to save from the Sent box (not the Inbox) as this is the place where the Bcc header is preserved.
creator: ssum
